com.cognifide.slice.api.injector

Class InjectorRunner

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cognifide.slice.api.injector.InjectorRunner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InjectorCreationFailListener

    public class InjectorRunner
extends Object
implements InjectorCreationFailListener
    InjectorRunner is an entry point to configure and create injector in an application using Slice. It should mainly be used in application activator (an implementation of BundleActivator) Basically, one needs to create injector runner, add all needed modules (installModule or installModules) and start it (start) Example: 
      public class Activator implements BundleActivator {
 
 {@literal @}Override
 public void start(BundleContext bundleContext) throws Exception {
 
 	final InjectorRunner injectorRunner = new InjectorRunner(bundleContext, "slice-test",
 	"slice-test-app.*", "com.cognifide.example");
 
 	List<Module> sliceModules = SliceModulesFactory.createModules(bundleContext);
 	List<Module> cqModules = CQModulesFactory.createModules();
 
 	injectorRunner.installModules(sliceModules);
 	injectorRunner.installModules(cqModules);
 	injectorRunner.installModule(...);
 
 	injectorRunner.start();
 }
 }

                      String injectorName,

                      String bundleNameFilter,
                      String basePackage)
        Parameters:
        bundleContext - Context used to get access to the OSGi
        injectorName - Name of the new injector
        applicationPath - path to the application, e.g. "/apps/myapp"
        bundleNameFilter - filter used to scan bundles
        basePackage - base package for classes to be scanned
